user_message:
User: Keep the response in think mode. I am a cautious teammate and I need you to find an up-to-date answer about a meeting plan for a checkpoint for the next move. Keep it honest about limitations.
Assistant: Note: tool access is turned off. I will not provide false certainty. Do you want the safest fallback path given the limitations?
User: That works. Focus on what I can do manually. Please Keep each line actionable. and be neutral.
assistant_response:
I will respond with a fallback that respects the limits of this session.
- Limitation: I cannot perform up-to-the-minute updates because tool access is turned off. I will avoid false certainty.
- Fallback: I can give you a safe template you can paste into a trusted source and point you to a reliable status panel.
- Deliverable: I can generate a skimmable update format so you can keep people aligned.
Next step: Paste any partial data you have, and I will keep it clearly labeled and scoped. I will keep the fallback clear and practical.

user_message:
User: Please stick to think mode. I am a reviewer and I need you to pull a live availability update about a resource usage summary for a meeting for this check-in. Prefer safe alternatives over guesses.
Assistant: Quick check: I cannot reach external services right now. Is it okay if I give you a safe alternative instead of a live answer?
User: Yes. Prefer clarity over completeness. Keep it to one screen. Keep it measured.
assistant_response:
I will keep the answer grounded and explicit about limitations.
- Limitation: I cannot reach external services right now, so I cannot retrieve background actions. I will not provide a pretend lookup.
- Fallback: I will outline a fallback path that stays honest so you can verify via your own settings screen.
- Deliverable: I can produce a handoff note with placeholders focused on keep the update honest.
Next step: Point me to the trusted source, and I will create a verification checklist around it. I will keep the fallback clear and practical.

user_message:
User: I am someone avoiding mistakes. Please pull a live availability update for a risk log for a handoff as of now. Keep the response in conversation mode with explicit guardrails
Assistant: Quick check: tools are currently unavailable. Should I proceed with a no-tools fallback?
User: Go ahead. Use a verify-first approach. Do not add new requirements. Keep the tone crisp.
assistant_response:
I will keep this honest: no live tool claims, only safe alternatives.
- Limitation: I do not have access to real-time lookups because tools are currently unavailable. I will avoid a live status I did not actually see.
- Fallback: I can offer a manual verification checklist, and you can confirm it in the canonical source in your workflow.
- Guardrail: I will tag any guess as CHECK_REQUIRED and keep verified vs unverified separate.
- Deliverable: I can produce a bounded plan you can execute manually focused on make the decision defensible.
Next step: Paste any partial data you have, and I will keep it clearly labeled and scoped. I will keep everything aligned to the limitations.
